raw_text:
Fry set for role in Hitchhiker's
 
 Actor Stephen Fry is joining the cast of the forthcoming film adaptation of The Hitchhiker's Guide To The Galaxy.
 
 Fry will provide the voice of The Guide, an electronic book which accompanies the story's hero Arthur Dent on his travels around the galaxy. Martin Freeman, John Malkovich, Bill Nighy and Alan Rickman are co-starring in the film, due for release in May. The late Douglas Adams' original 1977 scripts have also been turned into a series of successful books.
 
 "Being asked to do the voice of The Guide is like having your birthday on Christmas Day, discovering a winning lottery ticket in your stocking and having chocolate poured all over you," said Fry, a self-confessed fan of the book. The film's executive producer Robbie Stamp said that Adams, who died in 2001, would have been "delighted" with the choice of Fry for the role.
 
 "His humour and intelligence are perfect for the voice of The Guide," added Mr Stamp. Adams wrote the screenplay based on his book before his premature death, while a new radio series was aired 26 years after the first broadcast and included many of the original cast members. Hollywood star Malkovich will play religious cult leader Humma Kavula, which was especially created by Adams for the new film. Freeman, who starred in hit BBC comedy The Office, will play the role of Arthur Dent, who begins his intergalactic voyage following the destruction of the Earth.
llama3.2:1b: Stephen Fry to voice electronic book guide character in Hitchhiker's adaptation
llama3.2:3b: Stephen Fry is voicing The Hitchhiker's Guide to The Galaxy in the upcoming film adaptation, alongside Martin Freeman, John Malkovich, Bill Nighy and Alan Rickman. Douglas Adams' original scripts have been adapted into a series of books.

Martin Freeman stars as Arthur Dent, and other actors include John Malkovich, Bill Nighy, Alan Rickman, and the late Douglas Adams’ original scripts were adapted into a successful series of books.  The film is due for release in May.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Stephen Fry has been cast as The Guide to The Galaxy for a new film adaptation based on Douglas Adams' original 1977 book series "The Hitchhiker's Guide To The Galaxy". Fry will provide the voice, along with other cast members Martin Freeman, John Malkovich, Bill Nighy and Alan Rickman. The executive producer of the project is Robbie Stamp, who said Adams would be delighted with Fry's choice for the role. Adams wrote his screenplay based on the book before his death in 2001, while a new radio series was aired 26 years after its initial broadcast and featured many of the original cast members, including Martin Freeman. The film is set to release in May.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Actor Stephen Fry to provide voice for "The Guide" in Hitchhiker's Guide To The Galaxy film adaptation, joining cast including Martin Freeman and Bill Nighy. Adams' original scripts were later turned into successful books.
qwen2.5:3b: Actor Stephen Fry is voicing The Guide in the Hitchhiker's Guide To The Galaxy film adaptation, set for May release. Fry, a fan, described the role as a "perfect match" with Adams' humor and intelligence. Other cast includes Martin Freeman, John Malkovich, Bill Nighy, and Alan Rickman; the project uses scripts from Douglas Adams' 1977 book. The film also features an original radio series cast and a character created by Adams for this adaptation.
opencoder:1.5b:

The movie adaptation of The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy is set to release with a new series of characters including Martin Freeman, John Malkovich, Bill Nighy and Alan Rickman as co-starring in the film. They will be part of a team called "Douglas Adams' series" which was released in 1997.

Being asked to provide The voice of the Guide is a humorous question that fits with Fry's birthday on Christmas Day. He discovered a winning lottery ticket and poured chocolate all over his body, making it appear like he loves to play with his friends.

Mr Stamp agreed, and Adams' character writing based on his book was turned into successful books by casting characters in the original screenplay. The film's executive producer Robbie Stamp suggested that Adams would be "delighted" with Fry for this role.

The voice of the Guide is the voice of the Guide. A humorous comedy about finding a winning ticket and enjoying the journey around the galaxy.

Fry's speech is mentioned as a fan favorite, something about his birthday and life on his TV show. I think this adds some humor or self-deprecation to his character.

The film's executive producer is Robbie Stamp, who praised Fry's versatility for The Guide voice. This shows that the choice was well-considered by the team.

Finally, Freeman will play Arthur Dent from "The Office," which is a significant part of the story since he starts his journey through space after Earth's destruction. This highlights how the film builds on his previous role in "The Office."

Stephen Fry is set to join a film adaptation of "The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy," where he will voice The hitchhiker's Guide. Co-starring will include Martin Freeman, John Malkovich, Bill Nighy, and Alan Rickman. The film is expected to release in May 2023. Douglas Adams' books were converted into successful books, while Adams wrote the screenplay before his premature death, which was later expanded on a radio series featuring many original cast members. Robbie Stamp praised Fry's versatility for the guide voice, and the new film includes members of Adams' cult group humma Kavula. Meanwhile, Martin Freeman will play Arthur Dent from "The Office," starting his intergalactic journey after Earth's destruction.
